title: Flipped Learning-Based Virtual Neurology Education and Assessment Program

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic medical terminology and foundational neuroscience theories
context.additional_context: Neurology training program conducted in a smartphone-based virtual learning environment for current practitioners, requiring effective instructional design that replaces clinical field experiences through flipped learning and simulation/VR technologies

learning_goals: Learners can perform neurological examination procedures (reflexes, motor functions, etc.) with 80% accuracy via virtual simulations
Based on flipped learning materials, learners can explain the pathological mechanisms of at least three major neurological disorders (stroke, epilepsy, etc.)
Through VR-based case analysis, learners can apply differential diagnosis protocols for patient symptoms with over 90% accuracy in simulation assessments

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
